SENT.plain: Atrial fibrillation (AF) is the most common sustained cardiac arrhythmia
It is associated with significant morbidity and mortality
At the societal level, AF carries an enormous cost
Strategies aimed at reducing AF morbidity and mortality and containing the associated fiscal burden are of paramount importance
This review will discuss AF treatment strategies and economics, focusing on the impact of dronedarone, a novel antiarrhythmic agent
